Sibling of expanding market in event KXNEXTCOACHOUTNFL-26-2
fair_value_rationale: Todd Bowles signed a multi‑year extension with the Buccaneers in June 2025 and Tampa Bay has been a stable, playoff‑qualifying club this cycle, so the organization is unlikely to be the first to part ways with its head coach. By contrast, multiple other NFL coaches are publicly discussed as being on much hotter seats this season, making it far more likely the next coaching exit will come from a struggling team rather than Tampa Bay. ([buccaneers.com](https://www.buccaneers.com/news/jason-licht-todd-bowles-sign-multi-year-extensions?utm_source=openai))

reason: Sibling of expanding market in event KXNEXTCOACHOUTNFL-26-2
fair_value_rationale: Seattle is having a strong 2025 season (12–3, NFC West leader) under second‑year head coach Mike Macdonald, which makes him an unlikely candidate to be the next coach out before Feb 8, 2026. Most coaching exits in this window come from clearly underperforming teams and several coaches have already been dismissed or are widely viewed as on the hot seat this season, so other franchises are far more likely to produce the next departure. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Seattle_Seahawks_season?utm_source=openai))

reason: Sibling of expanding market in event KXNEXTCOACHOUTNFL-26-2
fair_value_rationale: Mike Tomlin is very unlikely to be the next head coach out: the Steelers are 9–6 and leading the AFC North as of Dec. 26, 2025, and Tomlin remains the team's head coach with a multi‑year extension and an unusually long, non‑losing tenure, which makes an in‑season firing or resignation improbable. ([statmuse.com](https://www.statmuse.com/nfl/team/pittsburgh-steelers-50/2025?utm_source=openai)) Several other coaches have already been dismissed this season (e.g., Brian Daboll, Brian Callahan) and there are clearer ‘hot seat’ candidates around the league, so the next departure is much more likely to come from a higher‑risk situation than Pittsburgh unless an unexpected scandal or health issue occurs. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_New_York_Giants_season?utm_source=openai))

reason: Sibling of expanding market in event KXNEXTCOACHOUTNFL-26-2
fair_value_rationale: Washington is a credible near-term candidate: the Commanders sit 4–10 with a long losing streak and recent blowout losses that have placed Dan Quinn on the hot seat in media coverage. ([commanders.com](https://www.commanders.com/team/standings/?utm_source=openai))  However, other struggling teams (the Giants already fired their coach midseason) and Quinn’s strong run in 2024 give him some leash, so I estimate about a 30% chance Washington is the next NFL head coach to leave before Feb 8, 2026. ([bigblueinteractive.com](https://bigblueinteractive.com/2025/11/10/brian-daboll-fired-mike-kafka-named-interim-head-coach/?utm_source=openai))

reason: Sibling of expanding market in event KXNEXTCOACHOUTNFL-26-2
fair_value_rationale: Aaron Glenn is a first‑year Jets head coach presiding over a 3–12 team this season, which makes him a credible early candidate to be replaced. ([newyorkjets.com](https://www.newyorkjets.com/news/jets-hire-aaron-glenn-head-coach-01-22-2025?utm_source=openai)) However, several other NFL teams are comparably struggling and owners often wait through the offseason/coaching carousel before making changes, so the chance the Jets are the very first head coach to leave before Feb 8, 2026 is modest. ([theringer.com](https://www.theringer.com/2025/12/17/nfl/ranking-top-nfl-head-coaching-candidates-2026-robert-saleh-mike-mccarthy-marcus-freeman-bill-belichick?utm_source=openai))
